channel.title: AdVerve
channel.description: Bill Green and Angela Natividad talk about advertising and pop culture the way they want. Every show a winner!
channel.generator: Feeder 2.3.6(1694); Mac OS X Version 10.8.2 (Build 12C60) http://reinventedsoftware.com/feeder/
channel.itunes:author: Bill Green and Angela Natividad
channel.itunes:subtitle: A podcast mostly about advertising and pop culture. And maybe a few other things.
channel.itunes:summary:
Does the world need another advertising podcast? Yep. AdVerve is Bill Green from Make The Logo Bigger along with Angela Natividad from AdRants (and Live & Uncensored). It’ll cover advertising topics that might make you laugh—or cringe.
Each week will be different because we’re trying things out to keep the format loose and the conversation unscripted. It’s not a daily ad recap or haven for press releases. Sometimes we’ll have guests, sometimes not.
Check it out.
channel.itunes:keywords: advertising podcast, marketing, social media, pop culture, snark

item.title: AdVerve 94 Collaborashun
item.description: Hear who took the big Lions at Cannes, everything Bill learned about the fireworks industry, and what search terms you'll need to outfit your next funeral via Pinterest. Seriously. We went there. (And we're only half sorry.)g
item.itunes:author: Bill Green and Angela Natividad
item.itunes:subtitle: Hear who took the big Lions at Cannes, everything Bill learned about the fireworks industry, and what search terms you'll need to outfit your next funeral via Pinterest. Seriously. We went there. (And we're only half sorry.)
item.itunes:summary: Bill Green and Angela Natividad talk about advertising and pop culture the way they want. Every show a winner!

item.title: AdVerve-93 The Return
item.description: We’re back. That’s right. The universe is shrinking and expanding at this very thought. This episode 93 replaces the Mystery Episode 93, Publicis shake up and more rant-worthy rants. YOU MISSED US! CALL SIGN: AWESOME.
item.itunes:author: Bill Green
item.itunes:subtitle: We’re back. That’s right. The universe is shrinking and expanding at this very thought. This episode 93 replaces the Mystery Episode 93, Publicis shake up and more rant-worthy rants. YOU MISSED US! CALL SIGN: AWESOME.
item.itunes:summary: Bill Green and Angela Natividad talk about advertising and pop culture the way they want. Every show a winner!

item.title: AdVerve 92 - ShagaMashaDelic
item.description: It’s Darryl Ohrt time! No better way to return from our hiatus than with friend of the show Darryl. We dish on his new Mash Studio gig and our love of all things shag rug. A special show with him and Angela in London. Get some.
item.itunes:author: Bill Green
item.itunes:subtitle: It’s Darryl Ohrt time! No better way to return from our hiatus than with friend of the show Darryl. We dish on his new Mash Studio gig and our love of all things shag rug. A special show with him and Angela in London. Get some.
item.itunes:summary: Bill Green and Angela Natividad talk about advertising and pop culture the way they want. Every show a winner!

item.title: AdVerve 91
item.description: Do we make anything? Angela kicks off by asking if non-coders in the content-as-commodity space really make anything, leading to what it means to be a deep generalist. Also, Apple's name, Putney Swope, and Kimdotcom’s newest Fuck-the-Man project.
item.itunes:author: Bill Green
item.itunes:subtitle: Do we make anything? Angela kicks off by asking if non-coders in the content-as-commodity space really make anything, leading to what it means to be a deep generalist. Also, Apple's name, Putney Swope, and Kimdotcom’s newest Fuck-the-Man project.
item.itunes:summary: Bill Green and Angela Natividad talk about advertising and pop culture the way they want. Every show a winner!

item.title: AdVerve 90 - End Of Days
item.description: It’s the End of Days Year-End special! Which means A) We just now put out a show recorded weeks ago and B) we cover everything BUT the End of Days. Starbucks and talking mermaids, our top five no holds barred/one-nite stand picks, iterative Lincoln films and filmage en général. It’s 2013 – you know what to do.
item.itunes:author: Bill Green
item.itunes:subtitle: It’s the End of Days Year-End special! Which means A) We just now put out a show recorded weeks ago and B) we cover everything BUT the End of Days. Starbucks, talking mermaids, top 5 one-nite stand picks, iterative Lincoln films and filmage en général.
item.itunes:summary: Bill Green and Angela Natividad talk about advertising and pop culture the way they want. Every show a winner!

item.title: AdVerve89-Zombieween
item.description: We cover NT1’s zombie guerrilla campaign, candy corn Oreos, book vandalism and why Bill is sick of zombies and vampires. In keeping with Halloween, there’s also a horror films tangent — appropriately kicked off by Angela’s recent decision to watch Cabin in the Woods. (Epic.)
item.itunes:author: Bill Green & Angela Natividad
item.itunes:subtitle: NT1’s zombie guerrilla campaign, candy corn Oreos, book vandalism and why Bill is sick of zombies and vampires. In keeping with Halloween, there’s a horror films tangent — appropriately kicked off by Angela’s recent decision to watch Cabin in the Woods.
item.itunes:summary: Bill Green and Angela Natividad talk about advertising and pop culture the way they want. Every show a winner!

item.title: AdVerve 88 - Spirit Animals
item.description: Angela attempts to impose new organisation onto the show, and all goes horribly wrong as things derail and we drift into wild, weedy territory: themed weddings, connectomes, tattoos, and — this was Bill’s fault — the prospective superpets of superheroes.
item.itunes:author: Bill Green
item.itunes:subtitle: Angela attempts to impose new organisation onto the show, and all goes horribly wrong as things derail and we drift into wild, weedy territory: themed weddings, connectomes, tattoos, and — this was Bill’s fault — the prospective superpets of superheroes.
item.itunes:summary: Bill Green and Angela Natividad talk about advertising and pop culture the way they want. Every show a winner!

item.title: AdVerve 87 - Antisocializing
item.description: The Colorado theatre shooting, Jim Henson's moral cutting of the Chick-Fil-A cord, NOAA's mermaid debunking, Bill's refusal to entertain speculations of android humanity, and we attempt a Proust questionnaire.
item.itunes:author: Bill Green & Angela Natividad
item.itunes:subtitle: The Colorado theatre shooting, Jim Henson's moral cutting of the Chick-Fil-A cord, NOAA's mermaid debunking, Bill's refusal to entertain speculations of android humanity, and we attempt a Proust questionnaire.
item.itunes:summary: Bill Green and Angela Natividad talk about advertising and pop culture the way they want. Every show a winner!

item.title: AdVerve 86 - The Wrap Of Cannes
item.description: We mighta outta shoulda called it The Rant After Cannes! It’s your extra spicy, extra ranty edition. We work in tech conference d-bags, Cannes beaches, social startups vs. agencies, and enough discussion around local colloquial to make ya sick.
item.itunes:author: Bill Green & Angela Natividad
item.itunes:subtitle: We mighta outta shoulda called it The Rant After Cannes! It’s your extra spicy, extra ranty edition. We work in tech conference d-bags, Cannes beaches, social startups vs. agencies, and enough discussion around local colloquial to make ya sick.
item.itunes:summary: Bill Green and Angela Natividad talk about advertising and pop culture the way they want. Every show a winner!

item.title: AdVerve 85 - Lincoln Zombiefest
item.description: Guest, loyal listener and BFG content manager Hal Thomas (@halthomas) joins us for a show that kicks off with vampires, detours through Pink Floyd and Pinterest’s new TOS, then finishes with whether Apple’s gonna do for TV what it did for mobile.
item.itunes:subtitle: Guest, loyal listener and BFG content manager Hal Thomas (@halthomas) joins us for a show that kicks off with vampires, detours through Pink Floyd and Pinterest’s new TOS, then finishes with whether Apple’s gonna do for TV what it did for mobile.
item.itunes:summary: Bill Green and Angela Natividad talk about advertising and pop culture the way they want. Every show a winner!

item.title: AdVerve-84-DisPinterested
item.description: Get your rage rant about social media lunacy, whether there’s a point to Pinterest and Chill.com. We take on pirates and breach Kevin Smith’s reality TV series Comic Book Men and Angela talks about the Pirate Bay’s new project: 3D Printing!
item.itunes:subtitle: Get your rage rant about social media lunacy, whether there’s a point to Pinterest and Chill.com. We take on pirates and breach Kevin Smith’s reality TV series Comic Book Men and Angela talks about the Pirate Bay’s new project: 3D Printing!
item.itunes:summary: Bill Green and Angela Natividad talk about advertising and pop culture the way they want. Every show a winner!

item.title: AdVerve 83 Scrapbook Truck Driving
item.description: We’ve waited so long to get this out that our cup-runneth-over with catch-up riffs! We tear the crap out of bad community management, people interrupting your well-paid public diversion with cell phones, and review movies we watched between shows.
item.itunes:subtitle: We’ve waited so long to get this out that our cup-runneth-over with catch-up riffs! We tear the crap out of bad community management, people interrupting your well-paid public diversion with cell phones, and review movies we watched between shows.
item.itunes:summary: Bill Green and Angela Natividad talk about advertising and pop culture the way they want. Every show a winner!

item.title: AdVerve 82 - The Attention Wars
item.description: We hit you with high energy mojo and a sudden segue from hints of Christmas to Super Bowl advertising to porn which turns into a long uncomfortable gush about why Redtube's Twitter feed is amazing (Angela's opinion, not Bill’s).
item.itunes:author: Bill Green & Angela Natividad

item.title: AdVerve 81 - Postgiving
item.description: A post-Thanksgiving celebration! This one has it all: Social Media and PR rock stars

item.itunes:summary: Bill Green and Angela Natividad talk about advertising and pop culture the way they want. Every show a winner!

item.title: AdVerve 80 - Halloweeness
item.description: Our fab Halloween show! WHAT ELSE DO YOU NEED TO KNOW. Movies! Mayhem! Racism!
item.itunes:author: Angela Natividad & Bill Green

item.title: AdVerve 79 -The Show Stopper
item.description: First, an announcement. LADIES AND GENTS, WE GIVE YOU ADVERVEBLOG.COM, a labour of love that incorporates the magic of Make the Logo Bigger, Live & Uncensored and Darryl Ohrt's Brandflakes for Breakfast.

item.title: AdVerve 78 - The Rapture
item.description: Pick a topic because like a pot luck from hell, it’s in here. Movies to watch, commercials to avoid, and politicians to vote for. But wait, there’s more: Other podcasts of note and blog projects to read.
item.itunes:subtitle: Pick a topic because like a pot luck from hell, it’s in here. Movies to watch, commercials to avoid, and politicians to vote for. But wait, there’s more: Other podcasts of note and blog projects to read.
item.itunes:summary: AdVerve is Bill Green and Angela Natividad talking about advertising the way they want.

item.title: AdVerve 77 - Eyepatch Edition
item.description: The show returns after a mid-summer hiatus and covers a lotta everything. The sexiness of eyepatches, Kevin Smith’s hockeyness, and why Sony lost its way. We also cover the odd movie and book or two. Just another day at AdVerve HQ.
item.itunes:subtitle: The show returns after a mid-summer hiatus and covers a lotta everything. The sexiness of eyepatches, Kevin Smith’s hockeyness, and why Sony lost its way. We also cover the odd movie and book or two. Just another day at AdVerve HQ.
item.itunes:summary: AdVerve is Bill Green and Angela Natividad talking about advertising the way they want.

item.title: AdVerve - Spirit of 76
item.description: The Spirit of 76 hits us as we cover a Wrap Of Cannes, official French grammar watchdogs, why The Dude wears a bathrobe and why no guy outside of a Big LeBowski convention ever should. You will not believe the places we go. Or maybe you will.
item.itunes:subtitle: The Spirit of 76 hits us as we cover a Wrap Of Cannes, official French grammar watchdogs, why The Dude wears a bathrobe and why no guy outside of a Big LeBowski convention ever should. You will not believe the places we go. Or maybe you will.
item.itunes:summary: AdVerve is Bill Green and Angela Natividad talking about advertising the way they want.

item.title: AdVerve 75 - Socialfication
item.description: Wherein your two cohorts in ad podcast deviancy wax poetic about social media hacks and posers. It’s been a few shows since we went off on those deserving of our... going off. Or something like that. TUNE IN.
item.itunes:author: Bill Green & Angela Natividad

item.title: AdVerve 74 - McGamification
item.description: Aka, that big, juicy badge in the sky. It was one mic/two guys as Bill took a roadtrip to Savannah to join one of his co-strategists in crime at BFG. Cyril Guichard (@luxregina) went live and uncensored on the topic of gameification.
item.itunes:author: Bill Green & Angela Natividad

item.itunes:summary: AdVerve is Bill Green and Angela Natividad talking about advertising the way they want.

item.title: AdVerve 73 - World O’ Wheaton
item.description: Alongside special guest Ken Wheaton, we cover stuff from book publishing and promoting, to the rise and further decline of American airline service, to whether advertising will protect us from the maniacal ambitions of Donald Trump and The Royal Wedding.
item.itunes:author: Bill Green & Angela Natividad
item.itunes:subtitle: Alongside special guest Ken Wheaton, we cover stuff from book publishing and promoting, to the rise and further decline of American airline service, to whether advertising will protect us from the maniacal ambitions of Donald Trump and The Royal Wedding.
item.itunes:summary: AdVerve is Bill Green and Angela Natividad talking about advertising the way they want.

item.title: AdVerve 72 - Southern Ad Law on the Skids
item.description: Michael McSunas (@adlawguy) of law firm CBS joins us to give perspective from the legal point of view. We cover everything from incest gameshows (they exist!) to legal precedent in cases involving both source protection and blogger disclosure.
item.itunes:author: Bill Green & Angela Natividad
item.itunes:subtitle: Michael McSunas (@adlawguy) of law firm CBS joins us to give perspective from the legal point of view. We cover everything from incest gameshows (they exist!) to legal precedent in cases involving both source protection and blogger disclosure.
item.itunes:summary: AdVerve is Bill Green and Angela Natividad talking about advertising the way they want.

item.title: AdVerve 71 - Autobahnn
item.description: Where we get AT&T’s Director of Social Media Chris Baccus to join us for among other things, taco gas station talk, organic food, and why Detroit does deserve a second chance. So yeah, pretty much what you’d expect from a guy who works for a telecom.
item.itunes:author: Bill Green & Angela Natividad
item.itunes:subtitle: Where we get AT&T’s Director of Social Media Chris Baccus to join us for among other things, taco gas station talk, organic food, and why Detroit does deserve a second chance. So yeah, pretty much what you’d expect from a guy who works for a telecom.
item.itunes:summary: AdVerve is Bill Green and Angela Natividad talking about advertising the way they want.

item.title: AdVerve 70- Fashion-Punting on Twitter & The Trouble with Airlines
item.description: We run a solid flowing gamut from customer service on Twitter to what travel's lost post-9/11. We throw back to Vinny Warren a little, ruminating the pros & cons of unexpected fame and where the New York Times went horribly wrong with its payment wall.
item.itunes:author: Bill Green & Angela Natividad
item.itunes:subtitle: We run a solid flowing gamut from customer service on Twitter to what travel's lost post-9/11. We throw back to Vinny Warren a little, ruminating the pros & cons of unexpected fame and where the New York Times went horribly wrong with its payment wall.
item.itunes:summary: AdVerve is Bill Green and Angela Natividad talking about advertising the way they want.

item.title: AdVerve 69 - Supermoon to Super Mario
item.description: We hit you with some old-school 5 for 5, running the gamut from natural disasters to sports marketing. Bill also wilds out on pet rights, and the whole thing basically devolves into a rumination on horror cinema.
item.itunes:author: Bill Green & Angela Natividad
item.itunes:subtitle: We hit you with some old-school 5 for 5, running the gamut from natural disasters to sports marketing. Bill also wilds out on pet rights, and the whole thing basically devolves into a rumination on horror cinema.
item.itunes:summary: AdVerve is Bill Green and Angela Natividad talking about advertising the way they want.

item.title: AdVerve 68 - Twitteropa
item.description: What are we on about this week? How pop culture is subtly changing as a result of technology, and even how changing technology has affected not only cartoon culture, but advertising and what we're being taught about human behaviour in entertainment.
item.itunes:subtitle: What are we on about this week? How pop culture is subtly changing as a result of technology, and even how changing technology has affected not only cartoon culture, but advertising and what we're being taught about human behaviour in entertainment.
item.itunes:summary: AdVerve is Bill Green and Angela Natividad talking about advertising the way they want.

item.title: Adverve-67-Politicosi
item.description: This time our love for Franco-American political discourse is matched only by our love for Frano-American recycling schedules. We then became winners discussing the fall and further fall of Charlie Sheen. Completing this gray matter trifecta: the Oscars.
item.itunes:author: Bill Green & Angela Natividad
item.itunes:subtitle: This time our love for Franco-American political discourse is matched only by our love for Frano-American recycling schedules. We then became winners discussing the fall and further fall of Charlie Sheen. Completing this gray matter trifecta: the Oscars.

item.title: AdVerve 66 - Relationships
item.description: Dear friend and fellow podcaster Bob Knorpp of the notorious BeanCast (@TheBeanCast) joins us to get intimate about relationships in advertising.
item.itunes:author: Bill Green & Angela Natividad
item.itunes:subtitle: Dear friend and fellow podcaster Bob Knorpp of the notorious BeanCast (@TheBeanCast) joins us to get intimate about relationships in advertising.
item.itunes:summary: AdVerve is Bill Green and Angela Natividad talking about advertising the way they want.

item.title: AdVerve65
item.description: Bill and Angela do the straight talk on their experiences getting work in this business, specifically from the perspective of social media or those who claim to “do it all” in an environment where that's exactly what people seem to be wanting.
item.itunes:author: Bill Green & Angela Natividad
item.itunes:subtitle: Bill and Angela do the straight talk on their experiences getting work in this business, specifically from the perspective of social media or those who claim to “do it all” in an environment where that's exactly what people seem to be wanting.
item.itunes:summary: AdVerve is Bill Green and Angela Natividad talking about advertising the way they want.

item.title: AdVerve64
item.description: Aka, the revolution will be retweeted. We’ve brought you a very special show this week. Renegade freedom blogger Mahmoud Salem (on Twitter as @sandmonkey), takes a good hour out of his revolution schedule to give us the skinny on what’s going on in Egypt.
item.itunes:author: Bill Green & Angela Natividad
item.itunes:subtitle: Aka, the revolution will be retweeted. We’ve brought you a very special show this week. Renegade freedom blogger Mahmoud Salem (on Twitter as @sandmonkey), takes a good hour out of his revolution schedule to give us the skinny on what’s going on in Egypt.
item.itunes:summary: AdVerve is Bill Green and Angela Natividad talking about advertising the way they want.

item.title: AdVerve63
item.description: Dave Wilkie of Where's My Jetpack? (@jetpacks) and Radio Free Babylon joins us for some good-natured ad blogger fun. We cover your questions, Old Spice Guy redux, revolution in Egypt, Taco Bell’s iffy meat situation, sexy robots.
item.itunes:author: Bill Green & Angela Natividad
item.itunes:subtitle: Dave Wilkie of Where's My Jetpack? (@jetpacks) and Radio Free Babylon joins us for some good-natured ad blogger fun. We cover your questions, Old Spice Guy redux, revolution in Egypt, Taco Bell’s iffy meat situation, sexy robots.
item.itunes:summary: AdVerve is Bill Green and Angela Natividad talking about advertising the way they want.

item.title: AdVerve62
item.description: We whip out an old standard: Five for Five, which takes us from life with two suns to Starbucks' fun-packed new iced drink size, Trenta, a whopping 16 ml bigger than the average capacity of the adult human stomach)!
item.itunes:author: Bill Green & Angela Natividad
item.itunes:subtitle: We whip out an old standard: Five for Five, which takes us from life with two suns to Starbucks' fun-packed new iced drink size, Trenta, a whopping 16 ml bigger than the average capacity of the adult human stomach!

item.title: AdVerve61
item.description: Theoretical artist Ben Kunz (@benkunz) of Thought Gadgets and Media Associates kicks off the year with us in a conversation about what the cool kids are after: Quora, curation, and a bigger TV in the basement.....?
item.itunes:author: Bill Green & Angela Natividad
item.itunes:subtitle: Theoretical artist Ben Kunz (@benkunz) of Thought Gadgets and Media Associates kicks off the year with us in a conversation about what the cool kids are after: Quora, curation, and a bigger TV in the basement.....?

item.title: AdVerve60-Holiday-Edition
item.description: Why not now, weeks later. Lousy family food and plenty of it. Blue Pitbulls. Assholes on Twitter – flashmobs in coffee shops. Sounds like holiday to us. We could tell you more, but then, why? JUST LISTEN!
item.itunes:author: Bill Green & Angela Natividad
item.itunes:subtitle: Why not now, weeks later. Lousy family food and plenty of it. Blue Pitbulls. Assholes on Twitter – flashmobs in coffee shops. Sounds like holiday to us. We could tell you more, but then, why? JUST LISTEN!
item.itunes:summary: AdVerve is Bill Green and Angela Natividad talking about advertising the way they want.

item.title: AdVerve 59
item.description: Guillaume Decugis (@gdecugis) of Scoop.it joins us to talk about the curation age, what makes the HuffPo model “special,” protecting journalists while serving users’ desire to share, and Silicon Valley versus the French tech scene.
item.itunes:author: Bill Green & Angela Natividad
item.itunes:subtitle: Guillaume Decugis (@gdecugis) of Scoop.it joins us to talk about the curation age, what makes the HuffPo model “special,” protecting journalists while serving users’ desire to share, and Silicon Valley versus the French tech scene.
item.itunes:summary: AdVerve is Bill Green and Angela Natividad talking about advertising the way they want.

item.title: AdVerve58
item.description: Aka, tech conference date rape. Those whose hands traverse the endless expanse of your, ahem, after a watered-down cocktail or two. What to do? Out them? Play it cool like Sam L. Jackson? We then WikiLeaked on Julian Assange as both hero and villain.
item.itunes:author: Bill Green & Angela Natividad

item.itunes:summary: AdVerve is Bill Green and Angela Natividad talking about advertising the way they want.

item.title: AdVerve 57
item.description: The Kardashians: Never have so many done so much with so little. We’re not hatin, we’ll take any endorsement deal. But ya gotta draw a line, no? Unless these three are just doing what we expect the rich and fabulous to do. NAMELY BE RICH AND FAMOUS.
item.itunes:author: Bill Green & Angela Natividad

item.itunes:summary: AdVerve is Bill Green and Angela Natividad talking about advertising the way they want.

item.title: AdVerve 56 - Get Whirled
item.description: SF-based Whirled's Joe Sabia, of Rockmelt demo vid, zombie speeding and Mad Men cigarette fame, joins us for some good clean all-natural fun. What's the difference between Vimeo and YouTube? Why plug a manifesto? What makes Tumblr so awesome?
item.itunes:author: Bill Green & Angela Natividad

item.title: AdVerve 55 - Thanks Givers
item.description: We get you in the holiday spirit with curious origins of Thanksgiving and some pre-Christmas foreplay. Bill manages to squeeze in a full-sized rant about the new TSA body scans while Angela reels the conversation back to the roots of Christmas stockings.
item.itunes:author: Bill Green & Angela Natividad
item.itunes:subtitle: We get you in the holiday spirit with curious origins of Thanksgiving and some pre-Christmas foreplay. Bill manages to squeeze in a full-sized rant about the new TSA body scans while Angela reels the conversation back to the roots of Christmas stockings.

item.title: AdVerve 54 - Monster Media
item.description: Culture journo Carolina Miranda (@cmonstah), the magnificent brains behind C-Monster.net, WNYC's Gallerina and the Perfect City documentary, joins us for some high-meets-low culture fun and games.
item.itunes:author: Bill Green & Angela Natividad

item.title: AdVerve53-Self-QA
item.description: Here's something we might do every so often, particularly when the Almighty Internet seems to be burning with curiosity. This episode we took your questions. Any questions. All of them.
item.itunes:author: Bill Green & Angela Natividad
item.itunes:subtitle: Here's something we might do every so often, particularly when the Almighty Internet seems to be burning with curiosity. This episode we took your questions. Any questions. All of them.
item.itunes:summary: AdVerve is Bill Green and Angela Natividad talking about advertising the way they want.

item.title: AdVerve52-AmericanTypographica
item.description: America-inspired graphic designer, compulsive truth-teller and typography stickler Aaron Draplin joins us to talk the real America. When we say "the real America," we're talking aesthetics. Stories and legends. Abandoned cities. Things we've forgotten.
item.itunes:author: Bill Green & Angela Natividad
item.itunes:subtitle: America-inspired graphic designer, compulsive truth-teller and typography stickler Aaron Draplin joins us to talk the real America. When we say "the real America," we're talking aesthetics. Stories and legends. Abandoned cities. Things we've forgotten.
item.itunes:summary: AdVerve is Bill Green and Angela Natividad talking about advertising the way they want.

item.title: AdVerve51-Ignoranima
item.description: We kick off with Maureen Dowd's article on how Sarah Palin makes ignorance chic, fertilizing the warm podcasty earth for the blossoms of debate: portrayals of women in power, patriotism and American governments/companies
item.itunes:author: Bill Green & Angela Natividad
item.itunes:subtitle: We kick off with Maureen Dowd's article on how Sarah Palin makes ignorance chic, fertilizing the warm podcasty earth for the blossoms of debate: portrayals of women in power, patriotism and American governments/companies
item.itunes:summary: AdVerve is Bill Green and Angela Natividad talking about advertising the way they want.

item.title: AdVerve 50 - Evaporatively Cooling
item.description: Deb Wiseman (@wisey) of Media Monitors revisits us from Down Undah. We play 5 x 5 x 5, explore existential topicality like dystopic futurists spinning social media into a hell-bound handbasket, Aussie do-overs, Gap's logo takeback, and cyber bullying.
item.itunes:author: Bill Green and Angela Natividad
item.itunes:subtitle: Deb Wiseman (@wisey) of Media Monitors revisits us from Down Undah. We play 5 x 5 x 5, explore existential topicality like dystopic futurists spinning social media into a hell-bound handbasket, Aussie do-overs, Gap's logo takeback, and cyber bullying.
item.itunes:summary: AdVerve is Bill Green and Angela Natividad talking about advertising the way they want.

item.title: AdVerve 49 - Immediacracy
item.description: Everyone has access to any story – or do they? People want it right now more than they want it right — maybe. Photojournalist Debbi Morello joins us for what can be only called stream of consciousness media rant meets technology with a journalism chaser.
item.itunes:subtitle: Everyone has access to any story – or do they? People want it right now more than they want it right — maybe. Photojournalist Debbi Morello joins us for what can be only called stream of consciousness media rant meets technology with a journalism chaser.
item.itunes:summary: AdVerve is Bill Green and Angela Natividad talking about advertising the way they want.

item.title: AdVerve 48 - Edumacation
item.description: AdVerve is Bill Green and Angela Natividad talking about advertising the way they want.
item.itunes:author: Bill Green & Angela Natividad
item.itunes:subtitle: AdVerve is Bill Green and Angela Natividad talking about advertising the way they want.
item.itunes:summary: Matt McDermott (@MMMcDermott) of post-production house Renegade, the Renegade Agency Confessional and the Baltimore Sun stops by to talk smack about the educational system. Along the way he tells a few hoary stories about his own experience teaching English at a hard-up Baltimore school.

item.title: AdVerve 47 - Edward Boches Deconstructs the Universe
item.description: CCO and CSMO at Mullen, Edward Boches talks Diaspora, that newfangled social node thing hell-bent on saving us from the privacy oblivion that is Facebook. But are we really that oblivious, or is it just the clueless ones that are all freaked out?
item.itunes:author: Angela Natividad
item.itunes:subtitle: CCO and CSMO at Mullen, Edward Boches talks Diaspora, that newfangled social node thing hell-bent on saving us from the privacy oblivion that is Facebook. But are we really that oblivious, or is it just the clueless ones that are all freaked out?
item.itunes:summary: AdVerve is Bill Green and Angela Natividad talking about advertising the way they want.

item.title: AdVerve 46 - Social in the South
item.description: Who’s taking Alabama social? The same crowd that brought Little Debbie digital. Luckie & Co.’s David Griner (@griner, TheSocialPath.com, AdFreak.com) joins us as we talk social in the Deep South, transparency, Alabama, and teased BP employees.
item.itunes:subtitle: Who’s taking Alabama social? The same crowd that brought Little Debbie digital. Luckie & Co.’s David Griner (@griner, TheSocialPath.com, AdFreak.com) joins us as we talk social in the Deep South, transparency, Alabama, and teased BP employees.
item.itunes:summary: AdVerve is Bill Green and Angela Natividad talking about advertising the way they want.

item.title: AdVerve 45 - Digitally Speaking
item.description: Kelly Eidson of Ad Age Gen Next fame, of I Need A New Job So I’m Going on a Job Trek fame, now of senior digital planner at Modea fame, joins us for a discussion on the still-there digital divide.
item.itunes:author: Bill Green & Angela Natividad
item.itunes:subtitle: Kelly Eidson of Ad Age Gen Next fame, of I Need A New Job So I’m Going on a Job Trek fame, now of senior digital planner at Modea fame, joins us for a discussion on the still-there digital divide.
item.itunes:summary: AdVerve is Bill Green and Angela Natividad talking about advertising the way they want.

item.title: AdVerve44-ThatMovieSucked
item.description: Movies we liked which may have flown under the radar over time. Docs, fiction, whatever.
item.itunes:author: Bill Green, Angela Natividad
item.itunes:subtitle: Movies we liked which may have flown under the radar over time. Docs, fiction, whatever.
item.itunes:summary: AdVerve is Bill Green and Angela Natividad talking about advertising the way they want.

item.title: AdVerve43-Viralosity
item.description: Everything you wanted to know about virals is what we got. Josh Warner of Feed Company joins us to discuss why a cool video isn’t enough to guarantee viralosity. You thinking jumping in jeans and throwing Ray-Bans around perfectly is easy? It takes magic.
item.itunes:author: Bill Green, Angela Natividad
item.itunes:subtitle: Everything you wanted to know about virals is what we got. Josh Warner of Feed Company joins us to discuss why a cool video isn’t enough to guarantee viralosity. You thinking jumping in jeans and throwing Ray-Bans around perfectly is easy? It takes magic.
item.itunes:summary: AdVerve is Bill Green and Angela Natividad talking about advertising the way they want.

item.title: AdVerve 38 - Vinny Warren
item.description: This week we hit you with guest Vinny Warren, Irish native and “international irritant” (per his Twit-tah). But you probably know him best for the creepy future-forward Wheat Thins thing he did with The Escape Pod, that wee little agency he calls home.
item.itunes:author: Bill Green, Angela Natividad
item.itunes:subtitle: This week we hit you with guest Vinny Warren, Irish native and “international irritant” (per his Twit-tah). But you probably know him best for the creepy future-forward Wheat Thins thing he did with The Escape Pod, that wee little agency he calls home.
item.itunes:summary: AdVerve is Bill Green and Angela Natividad talking about advertising the way they want.

item.title: AdVerve 37 - David on Demand
item.description: David Perez aka David on Demand, joins us for a look back at the Cannes experiment that was. HE GOT INK FOR YOU PEOPLE. In addition, we get into his role as creative recruiter for Leo Burnett in Chicago and what he looks for in job candidates.
item.itunes:author: Bill Green, Angela Natividad
item.itunes:subtitle: David Perez aka David on Demand, joins us for a look back at the Cannes experiment that was. HE GOT INK FOR YOU PEOPLE. In addition, we get into his role as creative recruiter for Leo Burnett in Chicago and what he looks for in job candidates.
item.itunes:summary: AdVerve is Bill Green and Angela Natividad talking about advertising the way they want.

item.title: AdVerve - 36 - Copycats
item.description: ADS THAT HAVE BEEN DONE BEFORE. Like, the exact same ones before. Joe La Pompe from joelapompe.net joins us for a discussion on twin ads: copycats or coincidences? As if that weren’t enough, Ask Wäppling, editor & publisher of Adland.tv joins us as well.
item.itunes:author: Bill Green, Angela Natividad
item.itunes:subtitle: ADS THAT HAVE BEEN DONE BEFORE. Like, the exact same ones before. Joe La Pompe from joelapompe.net joins us for a discussion on twin ads: copycats or coincidences? As if that weren’t enough, Ask Wäppling, editor & publisher of Adland.tv joins us as well.
item.itunes:summary: AdVerve is Bill Green and Angela Natividad talking about advertising the way they want.

item.title: AdVerve 35 - Moonwalking
item.description: No show is as topically diverse as this one. In the broader sense as well as this particular episode. This week’s rantage is set to fully-automatic: Guns, MTV’s TJnistas, Moon clones, Dov love and crowds soaring do not escape.
item.itunes:author: Bill Green, Angela Natividad
item.itunes:subtitle: No show is as topically diverse as this one. In the broader sense as well as this particular episode. This week’s rantage is set to fully-automatic: Guns, MTV’s TJnistas, Moon clones, Dov love and crowds soaring do not escape.
item.itunes:summary: AdVerve is Bill Green and Angela Natividad talking about advertising the way they want.

item.title: AdVerve 34 - Bob Knorpp saves the world
item.description: Bob Knorpp of Beancast podcasting fame joins the show for as we cover everything from Facebook to bloggers as journalists and a few personal topics.
item.itunes:author: Bill Green, Angela Natividad
item.itunes:subtitle: Bob Knorpp of Beancast podcasting fame joins the show for as we cover everything from Facebook to bloggers as journalists and a few personal topics.
item.itunes:summary: AdVerve is Bill Green and Angela Natividad talking about advertising the way they want.

item.title: AdVerve - 33 Harry Webber Edition
item.description: All kinds of magic this week, folks. We sit down with ad land myth-cum-legend Harry Webber and hash out agencies’ historical role as a government front, why Millennials are doomed, social media experts full of shit, and BP.
item.itunes:author: Bill Green, Angela Natividad
item.itunes:subtitle: All kinds of magic this week, folks. We sit down with ad land myth-cum-legend Harry Webber and hash out agencies’ historical role as a government front, why Millennials are doomed, social media experts full of shit, and BP.
item.itunes:summary: AdVerve is Bill Green and Angela Natividad talking about advertising the way they want.

item.title: AdVerve - 32 Steve Jobs Civil War
item.description: Aka, the A.D.D. edition because it’s all over the map topicwise. Who else can bridge Steven Jobs’ control freak with the Civil War and choosing sides? We then jump from that bridge into why boomers will never figure out Gen So What.
item.itunes:author: Bill Green, Angela Natividad
item.itunes:subtitle: Aka, the A.D.D. edition because it’s all over the map topicwise. Who else can bridge Steven Jobs’ control freak with the Civil War and choosing sides? We then jump from that bridge into why boomers will never figure out Gen So What.
item.itunes:summary: AdVerve is Bill Green and Angela Natividad talking about advertising the way they want.

item.title: AdVerve 31 - Scott Media
item.description: Scott Monty is Ford’s director of social media. But we go beyond Twitter doncha kno, as we first delve into Sherlock Holmes, then Detroit’s fascination with muscles per gallon, followed by brands blowing it when it comes to hiring for social media.
item.itunes:author: Bill Green, Angela Natividad
item.itunes:subtitle: Scott Monty is Ford’s director of social media. But we go beyond Twitter doncha kno, as we first delve into Sherlock Holmes, then Detroit’s fascination with muscles per gallon, followed by brands blowing it when it comes to hiring for social media.
item.itunes:summary: AdVerve is Bill Green and Angela Natividad talking about advertising the way they want.

item.title: AdVerve 30 - Where My Toyotas At?
item.description: Everyone gets it this week: automakers, conferences and... okay, maybe just those two groups. We actually like some things too! But the majority of the time we cover the industry’s continued fascination with the appropriation of urban culture.
item.itunes:author: Bill Green, Angela Natividad
item.itunes:subtitle: Everyone gets it this week: automakers, conferences and... okay, maybe just those two groups. We actually like some things too! But the majority of the time we cover the industry’s continued fascination with the appropriation of urban culture.
item.itunes:summary: AdVerve is Bill Green and Angela Natividad talking about advertising the way they want.

item.title: Adverve 29 - Ethicalicious
item.description: This week, we talk about Gizmodo and journalistic ethics as well as quarterlife crisis among our nation’s post-youth.
item.itunes:author: Bill Green, Angela Natividad
item.itunes:subtitle: This week, we talk about Gizmodo and journalistic ethics as well as quarterlife crisis among our nation’s post-youth.
item.itunes:summary: AdVerve is Bill Green and Angela Natividad talking about advertising the way they want.

item.title: AdVerve 28 - Failed America Edition
item.description: Well, if we didn’t anger the gods last show, Where’s My Jetpack’s Dave Wilke helps us bat clean-up. This time out, we collectively diss the failed promise that was supposed to be a greener, cleaner Jetpack in every home.
item.itunes:author: Bill Green, Angela Natividad
item.itunes:subtitle: Well, if we didn’t anger the gods last show, Where’s My Jetpack’s Dave Wilke helps us bat clean-up. This time out, we collectively diss the failed promise that was supposed to be a greener, cleaner Jetpack in every home.
item.itunes:summary: AdVerve is Bill Green and Angela Natividad talking about advertising the way they want.

item.title: AdVerve - 27 - God’s privacy policy
item.description: Aaron Strout of CMO of Powered, joins us to discuss agencies of the future now, why privacy is not only an illusion but something you can’t even buy, and, oh, by the way, we save the Catholic church.
item.itunes:author: Bill Green, Angela Natividad
item.itunes:subtitle: Aaron Strout of CMO of Powered, joins us to discuss agencies of the future now, why privacy is not only an illusion but something you can’t even buy, and, oh, by the way, we save the Catholic church.
item.itunes:summary: AdVerve is Bill Green and Angela Natividad talking about advertising the way they want.

item.title: AdVerve - 26 - George Parker
item.description: It’s George Parker. He of AdScam blog fame. Of MadScam and Ubiquitous Persuaders book fame. We cover in no order the arrogance of Apple, child labor, Crispin, critics, lawsuits, Microsoft, eBay, tag sales, iPad, Will it Blend, French things, and GoDaddy.
item.itunes:author: Bill Green, Angela Natividad
item.itunes:subtitle: It’s George Parker. He of AdScam blog fame. Of MadScam and Ubiquitous Persuaders book fame. We cover in no order the arrogance of Apple, child labor, Crispin, critics, lawsuits, Microsoft, eBay, tag sales, iPad, Will it Blend, French things, and GoDaddy.
item.itunes:summary: AdVerve is Bill Green and Angela Natividad talking about advertising the way they want.

item.title: AdVerve - 25 - Sexy time!
item.description: We didn’t intend to go where we did, WE JUST ENDED UP THERE IS ALL, OKY?. From Ricky Martin to fidelity in marriage (and Tiger Woods’ lack thereof), to copywriting jobs for adult film titles, no stone was left unturned this week.
item.itunes:author: Bill Green, Angela Natividad
item.itunes:subtitle: We didn’t intend to go where we did, WE JUST ENDED UP THERE IS ALL, OKY?. From Ricky Martin to fidelity in marriage (and Tiger Woods’ lack thereof), to copywriting jobs for adult film titles, no stone was left unturned this week.
item.itunes:summary: AdVerve is Bill Green and Angela Natividad talking about advertising the way they want.

item.title: AdVerve - 24 - The Lost Edition
item.description: We cover it all: Monkey AIDS conspiracy theories. Warren Buffet’s dance of love. Bob Garfield’s comments of... whatever they are. Angela then breaks down the difference between American and French dogs.
item.itunes:author: Bill Green, Angela Natividad
item.itunes:subtitle: We cover it all: Monkey AIDS conspiracy theories. Warren Buffet’s dance of love. Bob Garfield’s comments of... whatever they are. Angela then breaks down the difference between American and French dogs.
